comment: Worst professor I ever had. I have been awarded many times bc of my writing skills and I wrote great papers for her that i would put so much work and effort into and she was still the hardest most ridiculous grader. She would come up with things to take off points for. She wouldn't remind you in class about assignments or even mention them.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I had her for a hybrid course and I will NEVER take another hybrid course. She schedules things to be due at 9am and there aren't on the day of class. 3 major papers and ALOT of daily assignments that are textbook heavy! Be prepared to work for a grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I really liked her. She gives great feedback and she is there for you. She respects all of her students and the work is pretty easy for the most part. 4 essays and daily assignments which will help your grade in the end. I would take her again.

I had her one semester and ended up taking her again because I loved her so much! She is very helpful and will provide constructive feedback. You can talk to her anytime about any problems you have with assignments. If you show up to class and do all the little assignments, you will be fine. She is a tough grader, but in a good way.

She's a really nice lady. I am pretty good at writing, I never made less than an A in highschool. I made one B and 2 As on papers and straight As on easy homework reflections. She has everything laid out in pdf files for homework assignments. Prepare to spend about 2 hours per week on busy work. Major papers average between 3-7 pages. 4 big papers.

Professor VanHeirselee is a really cool teacher but expects. She gives multiple assignments a week along with frequent essays. She is a cool teacher who's funny but her explanations of assignments and essays suck. So confusing and unclear. She is also a hard grader and has only given 1 A on a paper so far this semester. I wouldn't take her again.

I took Mrs. VanHeirselee's class during the fall and it wasn't that bad for my first English class. There's 4 papers and all of them ranged from 3-4 pages, so it wasn't tough, but her grading was. I made a B on 3 of my papers and a C on the last. Don't skip class because she only allows you to skip 3 times before it's a letter grade.

She is a really cool teacher. Not very bad when it comes to work, but there definitely will be enough assignments. The only knock to her class is that when it comes to writing papers, she can tend to put too much time into what goes into the essay and not necessarily what the essay should include, like a guideline. It's rough. Awesome Class Though!

Mrs. VanHeirselee is awesome! She has a very sarcastic and witty personality, but students grow to love it. She's great at connecting with students and helping them when asked. You definitely have to work for a good grade, but it is possible to make an A in her class. The lowest grade I got was an 88 ( including papers). Book is needed!

I loved Professor VanHeirselee. About 4 papers throughout the semester, and after she grades them she gives them back to you with feedback so you can correct it for  a better grade. Also a few daily grades. Attendance is mandatory, plus she makes it fun so you wont mind going. I suggest going to the writing center for papers as well
